result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle Lowell Marlett

9:27 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Matthew Krische in court for Kyle Lowell Marlett. Defendant Kyle Lowell Marlett in court. Atty. Krische states there is not a resolution, requests 2-day JT. Court sets JT and FPT, notes settlement deadline. Adjourned: 9:29 AM. kma
Jury trial scheduled for March 9, 2023 at 08:00 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for February 23, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Settlement conference on July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. Bond continues.  Court confirms address.  Adjourned: 2:55

02:38 PM  Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: Unmonitored DAR, Clerk: Benoy   ADA:  Holly Elkin Rockow   DF ATTY:  Matthew Krische   DF:  Kyle Lowell Marlett appeared.   State calls Somerset Sargent John Farrell.  Witness sworn.  State direct.  Witness identifies DF.  Atty Krische cross.  Witness excused.  Atty arguments.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  State indicates Information will mirror the criminal complaint. Atty Krische wishes to proceed today.  Settlement conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Krische requests preliminary hearing. Court sets PH. Adjourned: 10:47 AM. kma  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 17, 2022 at 10:45 am.

3:13 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker, DF ATTY: Matthew Krische, DF:  Kyle Lowell Marlett appeared. Atty. Krische states that an offer and discovery has been received, requests additional hearing to allow time for resolution. Court sets PTC. records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Filed by DA's Office. km

Settlement conference on May 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on June 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, M.C.B.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

1:41 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Holly Elkin Rockow, DF ATTY:  Matthew Krische, DF: Kyle Lowell Marlett appeared. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands. Waives reading. Waives prelim time limits. Court sets bond. Court sets SETC and PSC. Adjourned: 1:43 PM. kma  Settlement conference scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Filed by Atty Krische. km
